intro: Corispermum elatum, commonly known as the tall bladdergrass, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits called utricles, which contain seeds enclosed in a membranous sac. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas or disturbed habitats. Corispermum elatum is typically herbaceous, with a life cycle that includes both annual and perennial growth forms depending on the climate.
